about.title: About the Task
about.intro: Using Vue.js, Vuex, VueRouter, and Vuetify, create an application. The header must contain a menu with two items: About the Task and Map. The main content should display the respective sections.
about.sectionContentAbout: This section should contain the task description, formatted similarly.
about.sectionContentMap: The screen should display a map and a list (see example):

list.item1: When clicking the add button, the map should enter marker addition mode: a marker should appear at the click location, and the list should contain an entry with the point's address.

item1Details.a: You can use any free geocoding API, for example:
item1Details.b: If the address is not found, show an error and do not add the marker to the list.

list.item2: Clicking on a marker should highlight the corresponding list entry.
list.item3: Clicking on a list entry should center the map on the marker.
list.item4: Markers must be stored locally and not disappear after a page reload.
list.item5: The selected marker's ID should be displayed in the address bar.

about.storageNote: Local data storage must be implemented as a service emulating a backend. (A Backend class is required, which pseudo-asynchronously saves data to localStorage.)
